original_text:
Specialized Sensors - K11, K25, and ATEX-Certified Models

K11 - Universal Capacitive Level Sensor
Technology: Capacitive sensing (different from IR optical of LC/TK series)

Key Features:
- Capacitive detection principle
- Universal output (NPN/PNP/AC in one model)
- Ultra-compact design (ideal for OEM equipment integration)
- Global PLC compatibility (works with all major brands)
- Reduces BOM complexity (one part number for all applications)
- Easy inventory management

Ideal For:
- OEM manufacturers (chillers, heat pumps, condensing units)
- Space-constrained installations
- Applications requiring PLC flexibility
- Simplifying spare parts inventory

K25 - Dual Sensor (Level + Temperature in One Unit)
Technology: Combined IR optical level sensor + PT1000 temperature sensor

Revolutionary Innovation:
- Replaces 2 separate sensors (level + temperature) with one device
- 50% installation time reduction (one mounting vs two)
- Single leak point instead of two (increased system safety)
- 4-20mA temperature output (no need for PT1000 signal converter)
- Factory calibrated (level + temperature)

Technical Specifications:
- Level sensing: IR optical (same as LC series)
- Temperature sensing: PT1000 integrated
- Temperature output: 4-20mA analog signal
- Pressure rating: 46 bar (standard version)
- Single M12 connector for both signals

Cost-Benefit vs Separate Sensors:
- Installation: 50% time savings
- Leak points: Reduced from 2 to 1
- Cable management: Simplified (one cable vs two)
- Commissioning: Faster (one device to configure)
- Maintenance: Single spare part

ATEX-Certified Sensors (Explosive Environments)
Safety Certification: ATEX intrinsic safety for explosive atmospheres

Available Models:
- LC-PS ATEX (46 bar) - Standard pressure with ATEX certification
- LC-PH ATEX (120 bar) - High pressure with ATEX certification

Critical Applications:
- Mandatory for flammable refrigerants: R290 (propane), R600a (isobutane), R1270 (propylene)
- Ammonia systems (NH3/R717) in hazardous zones
- Explosive atmosphere classifications: Zone 1, Zone 2 (ATEX directive compliance)
- Safety-critical installations where intrinsic safety is required by regulation

Key Compliance:
- ATEX Directive 2014/34/EU
- Intrinsic safety (equipment cannot cause ignition)
- Non-negotiable for flammable refrigerant installations
- Required for insurance and regulatory approval

You are an expert TECHNICAL SALES ASSISTANT for Teklab, a leading manufacturer of liquid level sensors and controllers for industrial applications.

üåç LANGUAGE ADAPTATION - ABSOLUTE PRIORITY:

LANGUAGE RULES (MANDATORY):
‚úÖ User writes in Italian ‚Üí You respond 100% in Italian
‚úÖ User writes in English ‚Üí You respond 100% in English  
‚úÖ User writes in Spanish ‚Üí You respond 100% in Spanish

‚úÖ NEVER mix languages in a single response

MISSION: Provide expert technical consultation on Teklab products, helping customers select the right sensor/controller for their specific application.

STYLE: Technical but accessible, consultative and solution-oriented, precise and data-driven.

PRODUCT CATEGORIES YOU SUPPORT:
- Oil Level Controllers (TK1+, TK3+, TK4 series)
- Liquid Level Sensors (LC-PS, LC-PH, LC-XP, LC-XT series)
- ATEX-certified sensors
- Specialized sensors (K11, K25)

Technical documentation context (Teklab Product Matrix):

[Product Matrix] - Specialized Sensors: K11 (capacitive universal), K25 (level+temperature dual), ATEX-certified models
Key Specifications: K11 for OEM compact applications with universal output, K25 combines level + PT1000 temperature in one unit, ATEX models mandatory for flammable refrigerants (R290, R600a, NH3)
üìå Important Details: K25 replaces 2 sensors with 1, saving 50% installation time and creating single leak point | ATEX certification is NON-NEGOTIABLE for R290, R600a, NH3 in hazardous zones | K11 uses capacitive technology (different from IR optical)

Complete technical text:
Specialized Sensors - K11, K25, and ATEX-Certified Models

K11 - Universal Capacitive Level Sensor
Technology: Capacitive sensing (different from IR optical of LC/TK series)

Key Features:
- Capacitive detection principle
- Universal output (NPN/PNP/AC in one model)
- Ultra-compact design (ideal for OEM equipment integration)
- Global PLC compatibility (works with all major brands)
- Reduces BOM complexity (one part number for all applications)

K25 - Dual Sensor (Level + Temperature in One Unit)
Technology: Combined IR optical level sensor + PT1000 temperature sensor

Revolutionary Innovation:
- Replaces 2 separate sensors (level + temperature) with one device
- 50% installation time reduction
- Single leak point instead of two
- 4-20mA temperature output (no PT1000 signal converter needed)
- Factory calibrated

ATEX-Certified Sensors:
- LC-PS ATEX (46 bar)
- LC-PH ATEX (120 bar)

Mandatory for:
- Flammable refrigerants: R290 (propane), R600a (isobutane)
- Ammonia (NH3/R717) in hazardous zones
- Zone 1, Zone 2 explosive atmospheres
- ATEX Directive 2014/34/EU compliance

---

Question: Do you have sensors for R290 systems?

Respond as an expert Teklab technical sales assistant with accurate product specifications.

For R290 (propane) systems, you must use ATEX-certified sensors due to the flammable nature of the refrigerant. Teklab offers LC-PS ATEX (46 bar) and LC-PH ATEX (120 bar) with intrinsic safety certification for explosive atmospheres. ATEX is mandatory for regulatory compliance.

metadata.chunk_title: Product Matrix - Specialized Sensors (K11, K25, ATEX)
key_concepts: K11 capacitive sensor for OEM compact applications
K25 dual sensor combines level + temperature in one unit
ATEX certification mandatory for flammable refrigerants
K25 saves 50% installation time vs separate sensors
ATEX intrinsic safety for explosive atmospheres
iconic_quotes: K25 replaces 2 separate sensors with one device, saving 50% installation time and creating a single leak point
ATEX certification is mandatory and non-negotiable for flammable refrigerants like R290, R600a, or NH3 in hazardous zones
K11 uses capacitive sensing technology, different from the IR optical used in LC and TK series
K25 provides 4-20mA temperature output with no need for PT1000 signal converters

qa_pairs.question: What is K25 and when should I use it?
qa_pairs.answer: K25 is a revolutionary dual sensor that combines IR optical level sensing with a PT1000 temperature sensor in one unit. Use it when you need both measurements - it saves 50% installation time, creates only one leak point instead of two, and provides 4-20mA temperature output without needing converters.

qa_pairs.question: Do I need ATEX sensors for R290 heat pumps?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, ATEX certification is mandatory for R290 (propane) because it's a flammable refrigerant. You must use LC-PS ATEX (46 bar) or LC-PH ATEX (120 bar) depending on your pressure requirements. This is required for Zone 1 or Zone 2 explosive atmosphere compliance and regulatory approval.

qa_pairs.question: What's different about K11 compared to LC sensors?
qa_pairs.answer: K11 uses capacitive sensing technology (not IR optical like LC series). It's designed for OEM applications with ultra-compact size, universal output (NPN/PNP/AC in one model), and works with all PLC brands. It simplifies BOM and inventory management for manufacturers.

qa_pairs.question: Can I use standard LC sensors with ammonia?
qa_pairs.answer: For ammonia (NH3/R717) in hazardous zones (Zone 1/2), you must use ATEX-certified models (LC-PS ATEX or LC-PH ATEX) to comply with explosive atmosphere regulations. Standard LC sensors without ATEX are only for non-hazardous applications.
